article: As I had my first child, I promised myself never to be a pushy parent. I was going to be a very _ and understanding mother. Five years later my little boy was about to _ for his yellow belt in karate . As a five-year-old child, he wasn't taking it seriously , because it was Mom trying to help him. I found myself yelling and telling him he would never get the belt acting like that. I was trying to _ him his back-flip . He continued to play and I continued to _ . Finally I had made him feel like he couldn't _ anything, just as I promised myself I wouldn't do. Still mad and stubborn I couldn't give in . I had to teach him his flip. He was doing fine with it by the time we had to leave to go to karate. While taking the test, he did _ . His instructor would ask him to do something, and it became _ for him. He never asked him to do the back-flip. He had passed his yellow belt test. We got in the car to go home when he looked at me and said "Mom, why did you make me do that back-flip so many times, _ it wasn't even on the test." The words wouldn't have _ anything to anyone else, but it was a slap in my face. That night while lying  He was _ and didn't say anything, just giggled. I said "I really do love you baby." I was still feeling _ , and also wondering if he had _ me. Finally he replied in the _ voice, "I know you do, but I love you more." He had forgiven me and I had decided that his feeling were more _ than any test he would _ take. I made a new _ to be better mother and to accept that he was only a child.
